verses.verse: By the rivers <S%H5104><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> there we sat down. <S%H3427><s%> Yes, <S%H1058><s%> we wept, when we remembered <S%H2142><s%> Zion. <S%H6726><s%>
On the willows <S%H6155><s%> in its midst, <S%H8432><s%> we hung <S%H8518><s%> up our harps. <S%H3658><s%>

For there, <S%H7617><s%> those who led us captive asked <S%H7592><s%> us for songs. <S%H1697><s%> Those who tormented <S%H8437><s%> us demanded songs <S%H1697><s%> of joy: <S%H7891><s%> "Sing us one of the songs <S%H7892><s%> of Zion! <S%H6726><s%>"
How can we sing <S%H7891><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%>'s song <S%H7892><s%> in a foreign <S%H5236><s%> land? <S%H127><s%>
If I forget <S%H7911><s%> you, <S%H3389><s%> Jerusalem, let my right hand <S%H3225><s%> forget its skill. <S%H7911><s%>

Let my tongue <S%H3956><s%> stick <S%H1692><s%> to the roof of my mouth <S%H2441><s%> if I don't <S%H2142><s%> remember you; <S%H5927><s%> if I don't prefer Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> above my chief <S%H7218><s%> joy. <S%H8057><s%>

Remember, <S%H2142><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> against the children <S%H1121><s%> of Edom, <S%H123><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of Jerusalem; <S%H3389><s%> who said, <S%H559><s%> "Raze <S%H6168><s%> it! <S%H6168><s%> Raze it even to its foundation! <S%H3247><s%>"
Daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> doomed to destruction, <S%H7703><s%> he will be happy <S%H835><s%> who rewards <S%H7999><s%> you, <S%H1580><s%> as you have served us.
Happy <S%H835><s%> shall he be, <S%H270><s%> who takes and dashes <S%H5310><s%> your little ones <S%H5768><s%> against the rock. <S%H5553><s%>
